content.body: For https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#attr-writingsuggestions can somebody remind me why the empty string is a conforming value for that ‚Äî¬†even though the table there only explicitly lists `true` and `false` as the allowed values?
content.formatted_body: For https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#attr-writingsuggestions can somebody remind me why the empty string is a conforming value for that ‚Äî even though the table there only explicitly lists true and false as the allowed values?

content.body: And note that at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=writingsuggestions the index of attributes is where the spec (though non-normatively there, I guess) states that the empty string is an allowed value.
‚Ä¶and similarly for, e.g., the `spellcheck` attribute, the index at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=spellcheck also says the empty string is allowed for that.
content.formatted_body: ‚Ä¶and similarly for, e.g., the spellcheck attribute, the index at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=spellcheck also says the empty string is allowed for that.

content.body: And for `hidden` too https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=hidden,-HTML
But looking at the whole index, I guess it‚Äôs just those three which the index says are allowed to have the empty string as a value. `hidden`, `spellcheck`, and `writingsuggestions`
content.formatted_body: But looking at the whole index, I guess it‚Äôs just those three which the index says are allowed to have the empty string as a value. hidden, spellcheck, and writingsuggestions

content.body: ‚Ä¶whereas, in contrast, if you look at what the index says about other enumerated ‚Äî¬†such as `wrap` at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=integer-,wrap ‚Äî¬†the index _does not_ say the empty string is allowed.
content.formatted_body: ‚Ä¶whereas, in contrast, if you look at what the index says about other enumerated ‚Äî such as wrap at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=integer-,wrap ‚Äî the index does not say the empty string is allowed.

content.body: see `popover` at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=popover,-HTML for another empty-string-not-allowed example
content.formatted_body: see popover at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/indices.html#attributes-3:~:text=popover,-HTML for another empty-string-not-allowed example

content.body:
d‚Äôoh nevermind ‚Äî found the requirement at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/common-microsyntaxes.html#enumerated-attribute:~:text=The%20empty%20string,-and

> For authoring conformance purposes, if an enumerated attribute is specified, the attribute's value must be one of:
>
> - An [ASCII case-insensitive](https://infra.spec.whatwg.org/#ascii-case-insensitive) match for one of the conforming keywords for that attribute, with no leading or trailing whitespace.
>
> - The empty string and the attribute must have an [empty value default](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/common-microsyntaxes.html#empty-value-default) defined.
content.formatted_body:
d‚Äôoh nevermind ‚Äî found the requirement at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/common-microsyntaxes.html#enumerated-attribute:~:text=The%20empty%20string,-and

For authoring conformance purposes, if an enumerated attribute is specified, the attribute's value must be one of:

  • An ASCII case-insensitive match for one of the conforming keywords for that attribute, with no leading or trailing whitespace.

  • The empty string and the attribute must have an empty value default defined.

content.body: So, the index is wrong (or incomplete/imprecise) in the cases where, for any enumerated attributes, it doesn‚Äôt explicitly list the empty string as an allowed value.
sideshowbarker: r? https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11974
beautiful
but now you make me feel like I‚Äôm just a lazy complainer üòÜ
will review it right now
Nah all good. Luke and I changed this around a bit recently as part of making reflection more formal and this is something we missed.
annevk: You need to put on your glasses; seems like you missed a few: https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11974/commits/02f24ef01e1c3dd7f4fb53ec43b5e692a80050d4

content.body: oh wait
Had you outsourced that to copilot or something?
sideshowbarker: I don't really understand your commit. Why would the empty string be valid for `autocapitalize` for instance?
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: I don't really understand your commit. Why would the empty string be valid for autocapitalize for instance?

content.body: The attribute needs to define an "empty value default" for the empty string to be a valid value. I only added it for attributes that define that.

d‚Äôoh yeah I see now you‚Äôre right ‚Äî I hadn‚Äôt read the requirements at https://whatpr.org/html/11974/common-microsyntaxes.html#:~:text=The%20empty%20string%20and%20the%20attribute%20must%20have%20an%20empty%20value%20default%20defined. carefully enough
so yeah then, that additional commit I made can just be ignored
Okay, I'll revert it and the squash & merge.

annevk: By the way, not trying to butter you up, but I am (again) reminded that basically any time it seems to me like you made a mistake or oversight, it‚Äôs very significantly more likely (or close to certain) that it‚Äôs me who actually made the mistake.
content.formatted_body: annevk: By the way, not trying to butter you up, but I am (again) reminded that basically any time it seems to me like you made a mistake or oversight, it‚Äôs very significantly more likely (or close to certain) that it‚Äôs me who actually made the mistake.

content.body: You seem to make exceptionally few mistakes. We could probably add a ‚ÄúMistakes that Anne has made‚Äù page to the wiki, and not even come close to filling up the page.

Hah, well I made a fair number of mistakes with custom element registries recently and Domenic was pretty good at spotting errors in my PRs as well over the years. I do try to be precise and do my due diligence, but I'm certainly not infallible.

About the index, I don‚Äôt see Keith around here, but I wanted to say, I notice the index doesn‚Äôt seem to include entries for `headingoffset` and `headingreset` global attributes.

And further, the spec doesn‚Äôt state any document-conformance requirements about the allowed values of those attributes ‚Äî¬†that is, it should rightly explicitly state somewhere that they are non-negative integer (`headingoffset`) and boolean (`headingreset`). (Which can be inferred from the implementations requirements, but should also be stated explicitly somewhere.)
